evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was observed and documented in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25 during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew is supported by evidence from the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim data and is not contradicted by alternative explanations or data.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident, including timing, crew interactions, and operational context in the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observed and documented within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA aircraft during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identified procedural deviation in pushback execution withstands potential counterarguments and alternative explanations, maintaining its validity against known exceptions and operational variances in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim context.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation aligns with key features identified in pushback operations, including timing, crew actions, and communication protocols specific to the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was observed and documented in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25 during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase.

assumptions: The observed behaviors and communications in H1-H4 reflect the communication/coordination state relevant to the incident
The continued movement beyond TRP indicates a coordination failure rather than solely procedural deviation
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination preventing the incident
If procedural deviation rather than communication breakdown was the primary cause

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H4 documents communication and coordination among crew and tug operators, showing a breakdown leading to the aircraft overrunning the TRP and hitting a barrier, supporting the claim of communication/coordination breakdown.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in distinguishing procedural deviation from communication breakdown

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident, including timing, crew interactions, and operational context in the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase.

defeaters: If evidence showed clear environmental or marking deficiencies causing the incident, or if crew communication was confirmed effective, the conclusion would change.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H4 describe crew interactions, timing, and operational context consistent with communication/coordination breakdown, supporting the claim and favoring R2_COMMUNICATION_BREAKDOWN over R3_ENVIRONMENT_OR_MARKING_DEFICIENCY as per discriminator disc:R2_COMMUNICATION_BREAKDOWN|R3_ENVIRONMENT_OR_MARKING_DEFICIENCY.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in whether environmental factors contributed beyond crew coordination issues
